intro: Galium hilendiae subsp. hilendiae, commonly known as the Hilendia bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor conditions.
